meanings.definition: The act of striking with a sharp blow or blows.
meanings.sent1: The whackings on the door startled me.
meanings.sent2: He received several whackings on his back during the fight.
meanings.sent3: The whackings on the drum made a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent4: Her words felt like emotional whackings to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The whackings of the hammer against the metal echoed in the workshop.

meanings.definition: A series of blows or beatings.
meanings.sent1: The whackings from the bully left bruises on his arm.
meanings.sent2: The whackings continued until he couldn't bear the pain anymore.
meanings.sent3: The whackings in the cartoon were exaggerated and funny.
meanings.sent4: The whackings of the waves against the shore were relentless.
meanings.sent5: The whackings of rain on the roof created a soothing rhythm.

meanings.definition: The sound of a sharp blow or hit.
meanings.sent1: The loud whackings of the bat hitting the ball echoed in the stadium.
meanings.sent2: The whackings of the branches against the window kept her awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected whackings of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The whackings of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The whackings of the axe against the wood filled the forest with echoes.
